name: Bilbo's birthday
description: Bilbo holds a grand birthday party and disappears at the end of it, leaving for Rivendell and bequeathing the Ring to Frodo.

name: Identifying the Ring
description: Gandalf realises Bilbo's ring is the One Ring. Frodo decides he must leave the Shire; Sam eavesdrops and gets to join him.

name: Leaving Bag End
description: Frodo leaves Hobbiton under the guise of moving back to where he grew up. The Black Riders search for him.

name: Meeting the Elves
description: The hobbits encounter High Elves in the woods and spend the night at their camp. Frodo shares his fears with the elves' leader.

name: Old Maggot's farm
description: The kindly farmer who knew Frodo and Pippin as kids treats the hobbits to ale, some news about Black Riders, and a basket of mushrooms.

name: Reaching the Ferry
description: Old Maggot, seeing that Frodo is in trouble, drives everyone safely to the Ferry in his wagon. Merry meets them there.

name: Crossing the Brandywine
description: Merry takes the rest of the party on the Ferry across the Brandywine river into Buckland.

name: Leaving the Shire
description: The hobbits sneak out as the dawn breaks and head for the Old Forest under the cover of mist.

name: Tom Bombadil
description: A mysterious singing stranger saves the hobbits from Old Man Willow, who is trying his best to swallow them whole.

name: Visiting Tom's house
description: The hobbits stay two nights at Tom Bombadil's house. He seems aware of and unaffected by the Ring.

name: Trouble in the Barrow-downs
description: The party gets caught in a thick fog at the ancient haunted site and trapped in a Barrow; they are rescued by Tom, summoned by Frodo singing.

name: Meeting Aragorn
description: The hobbits meet a stranger called Strider at the Bree inn. He says he knows Gandalf - who has left Frodo a letter confirming this.

name: Gandalf left Bree
description: Gandalf left the letter to Frodo in the inkeep's care, to be sent to the Shire; the inkeep promptly forgot.

name: Aragorn met with Gandalf
description: Aragorn and Gandalf met and discussed that Frodo should go to Rivendell later in the year.

name: Attack on The Pony
description: In the small hours, the Black Riders come upon the inn in search of Frodo and the Ring.

name: Starting the journey to Rivendell
description: Aragorn and the four hobbits head for Rivendell through the Bree-land, leaving the East Road to avoid pursuit.

name: Crossing the swamp
description: The party crosses Midgewater Marshes, hurrying to reach the end of the boggy land.

name: Encounter at Weathertop
description: Three Black Riders surround the party's camp on the side of Weathertop and manage to wound Frodo before Aragorn chases them away.

name: Gandalf searched for the party
description: Gandalf passed through Weathertop and left a sign for the others.

name: Crossing the Hoarwell
description: Aragorn and the hobbits cross the Last Bridge over the river Hoarwell, heading off the Road toward Rivendell.

name: In troll-country
description: Frodo is encouraged when they happen upon three trolls turned into stone: the same ones Bilbo tricked years ago.

name: Meeting Glorfindel
description: Back out on the Road, the party encounters the elf Glorfindel, sent from Rivendell to look for them.

name: Escape across the Ford
description: Pursued by all nine Riders, Frodo makes a desparate escape over the Ford to Rivendell, carried by Asfaloth, Glorfindel's awesome horse.

name: Waking up at Rivendell
description: Frodo wakes up from a long sleep and is told by Gandalf that Elrond has healed the wound inflicted by the Ringwraiths.

name: Reunion
description: Frodo feels much better in the evening, and is reunited with Sam, Merry and Pippin.

name: Dinner at Elrond's house
description: As soon as Frodo is healthy, Elrond holds a feast in celebration of the victory at the Ford. After, the elves sing in the Hall of Fire, where Bilbo is waiting.

name: Boromir arrives
description: Boromir arrives at Rivendell in the early hours of the morning, having ridden from the South at his father's command to seek counsel.

name: The Council of Elrond
description: Elrond gathers his guests from across Middle Earth, telling the tale of the Ring, answering questions, and crafting a plan to defeat the Enemy.

name: Boromir left for Rivendell
description: Boromir left Gondor to make the long journey to Rivendell.

name: Search for Gollum
description: Gandalf and Aragorn unsuccessfully tried to track down Gollum and find out more about the Ring

name: Research
description: Gandalf combed through Minas Tirith's library and found a scroll written by Isildur, containing a description of the One Ring.

name: Interrogating Gollum
description: Aragorn caught Gollum in the Dead Marshes and brought him into Mirkwood for Gandalf to examine.

name: News of the Nazgul
description: Radagast the Brown found Gandalf near Bree and told him that the Nazgul had left Mordor and were heading west.

name: Saruman's betrayal
description: Saruman revealed that he had forsaken the title of White; he was mustering orcs, and imprisoned Gandalf when he would not give up the Ring's location.

name: Escape from Isengard
description: Gwaihir, one of the Eagles of the Mountains, aided Gandalf in escaping his imprisonment at the top of Orthanc and brought him to Edoras.

name: Gandalf left Rohan
description: Gandalf set out from Rohan, riding the legendary swift horse Shadowfax.

name: Back to the Shire
description: Gandalf arrived at the Shire to find that Frodo has already left, and got news of him from Sam's father, old Gamgee.

name: News of the Hobbits
description: Gandalf learned from the innkeeper at The Pony that Frodo and the other hobbits had been there and had just left with Aragorn.

name: Gandalf gets to Rivendell
description: Gandalf reached Rivendell after managing to divert four of the Nazgul from Weathertop.

name: Conclusion of the Council
description: Frodo volunteers to take the Ring to Mordor and destroy it, and Elrond agrees that he should be the Ringbearer.

name: Gathering intelligence
description: Elrond sends out scouts, aiming to find out what happened to the Black Riders and other news about the Enemy's movements. Aragorn heads south-west.

name: Getting the Fellowship together
description: Elrond announces representatives of all the Free Peoples to go with Frodo and Sam; Merry and Pippin insist they should join the Fellowship too.

name: Bilbo's gifts
description: Bilbo gives Frodo his sword, Sting, and a light chainmail of Mithril.

name: The Fellowship departs
description: As night falls, the Fellowship starts on the long road ahead of them.

name: Reaching Eregion
description: The Fellowship reaches the former lands of Eregion from the north, and looks out toward Moria.

name: Attempt to climb Caradhras
description: The Company tries to pass over Caradhras, but the heavy snowfall and treacherous paths prove impossible to navigate.

name: Warg attack
description: Wargs attack the travellers after they come back down from the peak, forcing them to hurry to Moria.

name: The entrance to Moria
description: The Company finds the entrance to Moria and everyone manages to flee inside just as a lake creature at the doors stirs and attacks them.

name: Balin's tomb
description: In the depths of Moria, the Fellowship comes across the tomb of Balin, whom Gimli was hoping to find alive, and evidence of a battle.

name: Attack from the deep
description: The orcs attack the Chamber of Mazarbul, where Balin is buried, forcing the Company to flee on an unfamiliar route.

name: Balrog of Morgoth
description: The fiery dark creature pursues the adventurers, eventually being halted by Gandalf, who falls into the abyss below together with it.

name: Escape from Moria
description: After the loss of Gandalf, the rest of the Fellowship flees through the last chamber of Moria and comes out at the other end into the daylight.

name: Entering Lothlorien
description: The Fellowship enters into the forest of Lothlorien. They encounter some of the elves who live there and spend the night at their tree-dwelling.

name: Meeting the Lady and Lord
description: The Fellowship is brought before Galadriel and Celeborn, who listen to the tale of their journey so far and offer them refuge for a while.

name: Vision in the Mirror
description: Galadriel allows Frodo and Sam to look into the waters of her Mirror, where they see troubling visions. Frodo offers her the Ring; she refuses.

name: Departure from Lorien
description: The Company receives parting gifts from the Lady and, equipped with elven boats, Lorien cloaks, and provisions, sails down the river Anduin.

name: Jorney down the River
description: The boats float with the current down the Anduin, passing through the Brown Lands.

name: Noticing Gollum
description: Sam has also noticed what Frodo has been glimpsing occasionally since Moria: Gollum, who has been following them. He tries to creep into their camp.

name: Ambush at night
description: As the boats pass through rapids on the Anduin, they are ambushed by orcs. A Nazgul flies overhead and Legolas takes a shot at it.

name: Avoiding the Rapids
description: The Fellowship comes to impassable waters and take the boats on foot to the portage-way at Sarn Gebir, where they make camp.

name: Pillars of the Kings
description: On the boats again, the Company passes though the Gates of Argonath. The time to choose their further path nears.

name: The Decision
description: The Fellowship makes camp on the western bank, having come to the pressing decision of whether to head for Minas Tirith or Mordor.

name: Boromir's plan
description: Boromir tries to convince, then force Frodo to give him the One Ring to fight the Enemy. Frodo refuses and runs as Boromir comes to his senses.

name: Vision on Amon Hen
description: After using the Ring to escape Boromir, Frodo climbs to the Seat of Seeing still wearing it, and has visions of the war across Middle Earth.

name: Breaking of the Fellowship
description: Frodo, having made the decision to head for Mordor, tries to leave, but Sam catches him and insists to come along. The two leave immediately.

name: Boromir falls
description: Boromir fights and kills many orcs, but fails to prevent them from kidnapping Merry and Pippin. Aragorn finds him shortly before he dies of his wounds.

name: Burial
description: What is left of the Fellowship holds a river funeral for Boromir: they place him in a boat with the weapons of those he killed and send him over the falls.

name: Regrouping
description: After returning to the camp, the three find that Frodo and Sam have gone. They decide to look for Merry and Pippin, and leave the Bearer to his task.

name: On the trail of the orcs
description: The Three Hunters decide to follow the trail northwards to Isengard through Rohan. They find some of the orcs, killed by other orcs, along the way.

name: Reaching Rohan
description: Legolas, Gimli and Aragorn enter the land of Rohan in pursuit of the band of orcs.

name: Hopeful clues
description: On the grassland, Aragorn finds traces of Pippin's attempt at escape and a brooch from Lorien, seemingly left there on purpose.

name: Strange occurrences
description: As they run through the plains of East Emnet, Aragorn notices that the land is strangely empty and quiet and feels a dark will slowing them down.

name: First glimpse of Fangorn
description: The travellers stop on a hill near the Entwash and see the forest in the distance, but no sign of the hobbits or their captors.

name: Meeting the Rohirrim
description: The three meet Riders of Rohan, lead by Eomer, and learn from them that they met and killed the orcs, but saw no Halflings. Eomer lends them horses.

name: Vision by firelight
description: Gimli, Legolas and Aragorn camp by the edge of Fangorn forest and are surprised in the dark by the cloaked figure of an old man, who then disappears.

name: In captivity
description: Pippin wakes up next to Merry in the orcs' camp and unfastens his hand-ties while they quarrel about what to do with the hobbits and which way to head.

name: Towards Isengard
description: Saruman's orcs, having won the altercation, head for Isengard, dragging the hobbits along with them.

name: An Elven sign
description: Pippin escapes for a moment, long enough to leave his cloak's brooch in the mud for Aragorn to find.

name: The orcs flee
description: The orc band picks up the speed in fear of being overtaken by the Rohirrim. Merry and Pippin are dragged towards the forest.

name: Unlikely escape
description: One of Sauron's orcs tries to carry off the hobbits, believing they have the Ring, and is shot by a rider. The two slip off into Fangorn as the dawn breaks.

name: Meeting Treebeard
description: Merry and Pippin climb a hill in the forest to get the lay of the land and suddenly get picked up by a large tree-like creature, who explains he is an Ent.

name: In Treebeard's home
description: Treebeard takes the hobbits to his house and gives them a drink as they tell him their story. He resolves that something must be done about Saruman.

name: The Entmoot
description: Treebeard takes the hobbits south to where Entmoots are held. Many Ents are there, and they begin their very slow council.

name: The Ents go to war
description: The Entmoot elects that the Ents will march on Isengard. All of them and the hobbits head there immediately, having decided on stopping Saruman.

name: Traces of the hobbits
description: Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli continue their search. After some detective work near the forest, they enter Fangorn in hopes of finding their friends alive.

name: An old friend returns
description: The three come to Treebeard's Hill, where they see a different old man. He reveals himself to be Gandalf returned and assures them the hobbits live.

name: Gandalf's fight
description: Gandalf fought the Balrog through the deep tunnels below Moria until they both came out at a mountain peak, where Gandalf prevailed, but then perished.

name: Unfinished business
description: Gandalf returned to life, sent back until he manages to complete his task. He observed the world from atop the mountain until Gwaihir bore him away.

name: Gandalf reached Lorien
description: Gwaihir, sent by the Lady Galadriel, carried Gandalf to Lothlorien where he received from her messages for the Fellowship.

name: To Edoras
description: The four friends come out of the forest once again and hurry on horseback towards Edoras to meet with the troubled king.

name: Arrival at Meduseld
description: The party gains entry into the darkened Hall. King Theoden is under the influence of Saruman; Gandalf brings him out into the light and to his senses.

name: March to Isengard
description: The King and the Rohirrim prepare to ride out with Gandalf and his company against Saruman.

name: News from the front
description: A soldier meets the Riders, bringing news of defeat at the Isen; survivors headed for Helm's Deep. Gandalf advises the King to go there too.

name: Gandalf rides to Isengard
description: Gandalf races towards Isengard on his horse Shadowfax, having come up with a plan after realising what has happened there.

name: Preparing for battle
description: A scout reports that Orcs and wolf-riders are ahead in the plains before Helm's Deep. Theoden and Aragorn lead the Rohirrim to Helm's Gate.

name: Battle of the Hornberg begins
description: The Orcs attack in the dark and battle breaks out in Helm's Dike. Gimli and Legolas ready themselves for battle. Aragorn and Eomer defend the gate.

name: Orcs in the Deep
description: In the hours before the dawn, the Orcs infiltrate beyond the walls. Aragorn and Eomer rally the men, while Gimli and Legolas race for kill counts.

name: Final assault
description: The orcs penetrate the wall again, take it, and drive a portion of Rohan's forces back towards the caves of Helm's Deep.

name: The tide turns
description: Theoden and Aragorn charge out of the fortress at dawn. Astounded, they see the Dike filled with new trees and Gandalf returning with reinforcements.

name: Back to Isengard
description: In the evening, after burying their dead, the King, Eomer, Gandalf, Aragorn, Gimli and Legolas head to Isengard to speak to Saruman.

name: A wizard defeated
description: Upon arrival, the King's company sees Merry and Pippin, sitting upon the shards of Sauron's defences. Isengard has been trampled, and Saruman hides.

name: Longbottom Leaf
description: Finally reunited, the five friends sit in the sun and smoke, catching up on each other's stories, while Gandalf goes off with Theoden to see Treebeard.

name: Audience with Saruman
description: The company confronts Saruman, who tries to cast a spell upon them. Theoden defies him; Gandalf breaks his staff. A heavy object falls out the tower.

name: The Palantir
description: At the camp on the way back, Pippin sneaks out to look at the heavy globe that fell from Orthanc and sees the Eye of Sauron. Gandalf helps him recover.

name: Shadow overhead
description: A Nazgul flies over, riding a winged beast. Gandalf urges everyone to leave at once: the King to Helm's Deep; him and Pippin to Edoras, then Minas Tirith.

name: Delay in the hills
description: Frodo and Sam wander among the hills of Emyn Muil, unable to find a way down on the east side.

name: Perilous climb
description: The hobbits try to scramble down a less sheer cliff side but get caught in a storm. They hear what sounds like a Nazgul cry, but press on regardless.

name: Capturing Gollum
description: Exhausted, the hobbits stop for rest below the cliff face and notice Gollum creeping quietly along the wall. They capture him as he comes down.

name: Through the marshland
description: After Frodo has made Gollum swear by the Ring that he will lead them into Mordor and not betray them, the three head across the Marshes.

name: Corpse Candles
description: In the midst of the Marshes, the travellers see wandering lights; Frodo is mesmerized by them. Sam realizes there are dead bodies under the swamp.

name: Nazgul overhead
description: The three travellers see a Nazgul flying out from Mordor, just as they exit the Dead Marshes. It passes over them on its mount.

name: Towards the dark
description: The small party reaches the desolation before Mordor, where all vegetation ends, and bare, battered rocks stretch all the way to the dark mountains.

name: Gollum's doubt
description: Sam wakes up and overhears Gollum having a debate with himself over whether he should try to steal the Ring or serve Frodo as promised.

name: The Gate is shut
description: Arriving at the Black Gate, the hobbits see that there is no way to pass through. Gollum says he knows of another way into Mordor, and leads the way.

name: Captured by Gondor
description: After cooking a warm meal, the smoke gives the hobbits away. They are captured by Faramir, who knows they must be the hobbits who were with Boromir.

name: Safe for the night
description: Faramir questions the hobbits about their errand and Boromir's death, divining the purpose of the Fellowship somewhat. He takes them to a hideout.

name: Faramir's choice
description: Faramir finds out about the Ring. Holding true to his promise to help the pair, he lets them go free and gives them food, advice, and his blessing.

name: With the good will of Men
description: Faramir finds Gollum near his hideout and at Frodo's request captures him without killing him and lets all three companions go on their way.

name: Continuing the journey
description: Following Faramir's suggestion, the three stick to the west side of the road, inching closer to Minas Morgul before turning east.

name: The road to Minas Morgul
description: The hobbits and Gollum stop for a rest before turning east near the old road leading up to the fallen city, then continue under cover of night.

name: The Day without Dawn
description: The day comes, but not the Sun: a palpable darkness is crawling out of Mordor. The hobbits hide under a hedge until Gollum urges them to go quickly.

name: An endless climb
description: The trio reach Minas Morgul and, hiding in the hills, see a big army come out the gates. Terrified, they wait it out and then hurry up onto a long set of stairs.

name: At the mouth of the cave
description: After climbing all the way up two long flights of stairs, they reach the entrance to a tunnel where Gollum has been leading them - Shelob's Lair.

name: Gollum's plot
description: Suddenly left by Gollum in the tunnel, the hobbits realise they're being watched. They're attacked by Shelob the Spider and try to run away.

name: Frodo captured
description: Shelob springs on Frodo as Sam, trying to warn him, is tackled by Gollum and fights him off. Frodo is taken by the spider and Sam runs after.

name: Sam carries on
description: Sam charges at the spider, armed with Sting and the Phial, and defeats it, but Frodo is unresponsive. Thinking him dead, he resolves to finish the quest.

name: In the hands of the enemy
description: Orcs appear; Sam puts on the Ring in a panic. He sees them take Frodo and tails them. From their talk he gathers Frodo's alive, but they go into the tower.

name: Stop at Edoras
description: Gandalf and Pippin arrive at Edoras. Pippin sleeps in a corner while Gandalf gives orders before their departure.

name: Beacons alight
description: Gandalf and Pippin see the beacons on the mountains surrounding Gondor are lit, calling for aid in the time of war.

name: Minas Tirith
description: Gandalf and Pippin arrive at the gate of Minas Tirith as the dawn breaks.

name: A debt to repay
description: Denethor questions Pippin about Boromir's death. Pippin tells the Steward that his son died to save him and Merry, and offers his services in return.

name: Pippin gets shown the ropes
description: While Gandalf is off learning the news, Pippin spends some time with a guard of Denethor's and learns about Gondor.

name: Gathering forces
description: Pippin watches as lords from different ends of Gondor come through the Gate with their soldiers, getting ready for an assault on the city.

name: There will be no dawn
description: Pippin wakes to see Gandalf is back at their lodging room. The wizard tells him they'll be summoned by Denethor, and that the Darkness has begun.

name: The Gray Company
description: Riding back towards Edoras, the King's company is stopped by riders, who turn out to be Rangers looking for Aragorn, coming to help him.

name: A parting of ways
description: After a night at Hornburg, the King continues to Edoras; Aragorn decides he will ride through the Paths of the Dead with the Rangers, Legolas, and Gimli.

name: Eowyn's duty
description: Aragorn's party passes Edoras and makes an overnight stop at Dunharrow, where Eowyn awaits news. She asks to join his quest but he declines.

name: Summoning the Dead
description: Aragorn leads the Rangers and his friends into the passage, where he summons the vow-breaking Dead. They let him pass and follow close behind.

name: An oath fulfilled
description: Legolas and Gimli see the ghostly army following behind them, heading to battle with Isildur's heir so they may finally find rest after.

name: Into the Storm
description: The Day without Dawn comes, and Aragorn, followed by the Dead army, rides into the Storm of Mordor.

name: Gondor calls
description: Theoden and his entourage are met by Eowyn at Dunharrow. A messenger from Gondor arrives and asks the King to come to Denethor's aid.

name: The Muster of Rohan
description: Merry wakes up to no sun and goes to the King, who sees the war is on and gathers his forces to leave for Edoras at once. Eowyn gives Merry battle gear.

name: Leaving for battle
description: After a short stop at Edoras, the King rides for Gondor. He wants to leave Merry in the relative safety of Rohan, but a masked Rider offers the hobbit a ride.

name: Black Riders of the air
description: Five of the Nazgul circle over the fields of Pelennor, chasing the returning Faramir, as Pippin watches from an embrasure; Gandalf chases them off.

name: News of Frodo
description: Faramir tells Denethor of events in Ithilien and of meeting Frodo and Sam. Pippin notices that even Gandalf seems afraid when he hears where they went.

name: Faramir makes a stand
description: Gandalf rides out to Osgiliath to meet Faramir, who went out on Denethor's orders to prevent the enemy forces from crossing, but has had to retreat.

name: Captain of Despair
description: Gandalf returns with some wounded men and brings news that the enemy forces are being led by the King of Angmar; the Siege of Gondor has started.

name: Siege of Minas Tirith
description: Faramir is gravely wounded, saved only by Gandalf chasing away the Nazgul once again. The city is besieged.

name: Gandalf leads the defence
description: The city is firebombed; morale is low. Pippin is with Denethor as he sits at Faramir's bed, convinced his son is dying. Gandalf takes command instead.

name: Breach of the City
description: Denethor releases Pippin from his service and decides to go out in flames together with his last remaining son. The Gate is breached before dawn.

name: Help on the way
description: Pippin runs to find Gandalf and sees him as he faces the Nazgul King. The horns of Rohan are heard in the distance as the rooster crows.

name: Unexpected aid
description: The Rohirrim camp out near Druadan Forest. Merry eavesdrops on Theoden's audience with one of the Wild Men living there, who offers aid to the King.

name: A secret road
description: Ghan-buri-Ghan of the woods leads the host of Rohan through a forgotten route past the orcs who await them.

name: Theoden leads the charge
description: Theoden reaches the plains below Minas Tirith and charges ahead, and so Merry rides into battle with his masked friend.

name: Theoden falls
description: After significant damage to the enemy, the charge is stopped by a Nazgul cry, which terrifies the horses. Theoden's horse stumbles and falls on top of him.

name: The Ringwraith is killed
description: Merry realises his Rider is Eowyn, who faces the King of Angmar. She kills his beast in one hit. Merry stabs the Wraith and gives her a chance to finish it.

name: Death of a King
description: Theoden dies, passing his title to Eomer, who sees his sister, seemingly dead as well, and rides into battle with his men in a blind rage. Merry is left behind.

name: The Return of the King
description: Black ships come up the river and the soldiers lose hope, thinking it's the Corsairs of Umbar, but soon realise the ships carry Aragorn, who has taken them.

name: Victory at Pelennor
description: After Aragorn turns the tide of the battle, by sunset every foe is either dead or routed; none return to Mordor. The survivors return to the city.

name: Gandalf leaves the battle
description: After the Black Rider withdraws towards the battle, Pippin manages to tell Gandalf about the Steward's madness, and the two rush back up to stop him.

name: The pyre of Denethor
description: Gandalf takes Faramir away, but Denethor reveals a Palantir and claims to have seen defeat in it; he then sets himself aflame in the royal tomb chambers.

name: Houses of Healing
description: Merry and Pippin are reunited, and Pippin takes his friend to the Houses of Healing to be treated. Gandalf tends to Faramir, Eowyn and Merry.

name: Hands of a healer
description: Aragorn uses his healing knowledge to help the wounded, fulfilling an old prophecy that the hands of the rightful king are the hands of a healer.

name: Respite with friends
description: Legolas and Gimli climb up to the Houses of Healing and reunite with their hobbit friends. They recount their adventures with Aragorn and the ghost army.

name: Commandeering the fleet
description: Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli, the Rangers, and the Dead army arrive at Anduin, where they overtake the Corsairs' ships and head to Minas Tirith.

name: An army of terror
description: With the help of the Dead, Aragorn scatters the soldiers of Umbar and Harad and recruits the local Lamedon folk to help him commandeer the ships.

name: Last council
description: Aragorn and Gandalf take counsel with Prince Imrahil, Eomer, and the sons of Elrond in a tent in front of the gate: Aragorn doesn't want to claim his title yet.

name: Nothing to lose
description: Gandalf advises the lords that the only way to have a chance is to keep the Eye distracted until the Ring is destroyed, and so they agree to attack Mordor.

name: The last throw
description: The army of the West assembles in the fields of Pelennor and leaves for the Black Gate.

name: Through Old Gondor
description: The army passes through Osgiliath, where workers and craftsmen salvage materials and strengthen defences.

name: On the old road
description: Defences are set up at the Crossroads in case the Enemy might send forces from Morgul Vale or the South.

name: Burning the Nazgul city
description: Aragorn and Gandalf ride to Minas Morgul and, seeing it empty after the big battle, burn down the bridge and set fire to the surrounding field.

name: Reclaiming the lands
description: Walking up the road to the Morannon, the heralds of the army announce the coming of the King and claim the surrounding land for Gondor.

name: Mercy over honour
description: Aragorn sees that many of the farmers from Rohan and Lossarnach are too afraid and untrained, and sends them away from Mordor to retake Cair Andros.

name: Night before the battle
description: The army camps at the Black Gate. They hear wolves and other creatures of Mordor prowl about, and no one sleeps.

name: The Mouth of Sauron
description: Representatives of all the free peoples of Middle Earth march up to challenge Sauron, and the Black Gate opens. His messenger has Frodo's armour.

name: Battle of the Morannon
description: Gandalf rejects Mordor's terms and takes back Frodo's things. Sauron pours out armies from the Gate and the battle begins.

name: The Eagles are coming
description: Pippin is stunned by a mountain troll as he kills it, and as he loses consciousness he hears cries around him that the Eagles are coming.
